item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 Goes Live: Best Deals on Mobiles, Electronics - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 Is Live: Best Deals

Date: 2025
Source: Gadgets 360

Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 is now live for everyone, offering discounts on various electronics including mobile phones, laptops, and Amazon devices.

  • The sale offers a range of exciting discounts on popular electronics, with particular deals on mobile phones and laptops.
  • SBI credit card users can avail a 10% additional discount during the sale.
  • Featured offers include:
    • Apple iPhone 15 (128GB) at Rs. 55,499.
    • Samsung Galaxy M35 5G at Rs. 13,999.
    • Oppo F27 Pro+ 5G at Rs. 23,400.
    • Lenovo IdeaPad Pro 5 at Rs. 1,03,990 (MRP Rs. 1,46,890).
  • Amazon devices such as Fire TV Stick and Echo series gadgets also see significant discounts.
“Affiliate links may be automatically generated - see our ethics statement for details.”

The Great Republic Day Sale 2025 offers significant savings on a plethora of electronics, making it a great opportunity for shoppers looking for deals.

item.title: Laxmi Dental IPO gets fully subscribed within 90 minutes on Day 1, retail portion booked 4x - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Laxmi Dental IPO gets fully subscribed within 90 minutes on Day 1, retail portion booked 4x

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Laxmi Dental IPO experienced a significant rush, fully subscribing within just 90 minutes on its opening day, with retail investors leading the charge.

  • The IPO size is Rs 698 crore.
  • Subscription reached 1.25 times within 90 minutes of opening.
  • Retail investors subscribed 4.26 times their allotted portion.
  • The non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 1.76 times.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) portion has yet to see any bids.
  • Price band set between Rs 407 and Rs 428 per share.
  • Investors can bid for a minimum of 33 shares, costing Rs 14,124.
  • Grey market premium stood at around 37%, indicating strong market interest.
"The portion reserved for non-institutional investors has been subscribed 1.76 times so far."

This enthusiastic subscription indicates strong demand and could bode well for Laxmi Dental’s future performance in the market.

item.title: Rupee breaches 86 against US dollar on strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rupee Falls Past 86 Against US Dollar Due to Strong Dollar and Weak FII Inflows

Date: February 7, 2025
Source: The Indian Express

The rupee opened at a record low of 86.12 against the US dollar as a strong dollar and foreign investor outflows weigh on the domestic currency, with higher crude oil prices exacerbating the situation.

  • The rupee fell to a fresh low of 86.31 on Monday.
  • Key factors for the decline include a robust US jobs report and a rising dollar.
  • Approximately $4.2 billion exited Indian markets in January 2025.
  • Current predictions suggest the rupee may trade between 85.80 and 86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors

The combination of a strong dollar, increased crude oil prices, and capital outflows from foreign investors presents challenges for the rupee, necessitating careful monitoring of future economic policies.

item.title: Delhi High Court refuses Gensol's request to restrain Mahindra from selling 'eZEO' EV - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Rejects Gensol's Bid to Halt Mahindra's eZEO EV Sales

Published on: 13 Jan 2025, 6:38 am

The Delhi High Court has denied Gensol Electric Vehicles' request for an injunction against Mahindra from selling its new Electric Vehicle (EV) 'eZEO'. The court found that Gensol did not provide sufficient grounds for the interim relief sought.

  • Gensol claims it owns the trademark 'eZio' and is concerned about potential public confusion with Mahindra's 'eZEO'.
  • Justice Amit Bansal dismissed the application noting the lack of a compelling case for an interim injunction.
  • The court has instructed Mahindra to respond to Gensol's claims within ten days.
  • Gensol plans to launch its 'Ezio' EV at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, while Mahindra's eZEO is designed for last-mile delivery.
"The applicant (Gensol) has failed to make a case for interim injunction. The application is dismissed."

In conclusion, the court's ruling allows Mahindra to proceed with the sales of its eZEO electric vehicle while Gensol prepares for its upcoming launch.

item.title: IREDA share price jumps over 5% on strong guidance, ₹4,500-crore QIP buzz | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
IREDA Share Price Rises Over 5% Following Positive Guidance and ₹4,500-Crore QIP News

Publication Date: Date Not Specified
Source: Live Mint

IREDA's share price saw a significant increase of over 5%, jumping as much as 5.51% to ₹212.30 on the BSE despite a broader market downturn, fueled by strong company guidance and expectations surrounding a ₹4,500-crore QIP.

  • IREDA's stock movement is linked to the announcement of tentative timelines for a ₹4,500-crore Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP).
  • The company reported a net profit of ₹425.38 crore for Q3 FY25, a 27% increase from the previous year.
  • IREDA is expecting to strengthen its capital base with the upcoming equity issue.
  • Analysts suggest holding IREDA shares with a stop loss at ₹190 and a target price between ₹230 to ₹240.
“The fundraising exercise aims to strengthen IREDA’s capital base and accelerate India’s transition to clean energy.” - IREDA Regulatory Filing

In conclusion, the positive signals from IREDA's management and strong quarterly results are positioning the company favorably in the renewable energy sector.

item.title: Laxmi Dental IPO fully subscribed within hours on opening day; check lot size, key dates - Upstox
item.description:
Laxmi Dental IPO Fully Subscribed on Opening Day

Publication Date: January 13, Source: Upstox

The initial public offer (IPO) of Laxmi Dental was fully subscribed within hours of opening, with significant interest from retail and non-institutional investors.

Key Points

  • The Laxmi Dental IPO was fully subscribed by 11:22 am on January 13.
  • Overall subscription was at 1.11 times, with bids for 99.78 lakh shares against 89.70 lakh shares on offer.
  • The non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 1.52 times.
  • The retail investors' category was booked 3.83 times.
  • The IPO features a price range of ₹407-₹428 per share.
  • Key dates are January 13-15 for bidding, with a listing date on January 20.
“The net proceeds will be used to clear debt, fund capital expenditure, and for general corporate purposes.”

In conclusion, the strong demand for Laxmi Dental's IPO indicates investor confidence in the company’s business model and future growth potential.

item.title: IndusInd Bank shares jump 4%, top Nifty gainer amid potential MSCI inflows - Moneycontrol
item.description:
IndusInd Bank shares jump 4%, top Nifty gainer amid potential MSCI inflows

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

IndusInd Bank shares rose by 4% to Rs 973, becoming the top gainer on the Nifty 50 index, following an increase in foreign headroom after a recent FII sell-off.

  • FII stake decreased from 55.5% to 46.6% in December.
  • Foreign headroom now exceeds the 25% threshold.
  • Potential doubling of MSCI weight anticipated to attract inflows of $250 million to $300 million.
  • The effects of this change are expected over the next 3 to 5 trading days.
  • The rebalancing and inflows will be seen on February 28, 2025.
“MSCI weight doubling is expected to attract inflows of around $250 million to $300 million.”

The surge in IndusInd Bank's stock is primarily due to the expected increase in MSCI weight stemming from a significant change in shareholding. This could lead to considerable investor interest and further stock performance in the near term.

item.title: Crude Oil on the Boil: HPCL shares fall 7%; here's how others are impacted - CNBCTV18
item.description:
HPCL Shares Drop 7% Amid Rising Crude Oil Prices

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of India's Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (HPCL) have dropped 7% as crude oil prices surge, impacting other oil marketing companies and related sectors.

  • HPCL shares are down 7%, with Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (BPCL) and Indian Oil Corporation Ltd. (IOC) down 3% and 4%, respectively.
  • Brent crude has risen above $81 a barrel to its highest price in over four months.
  • The increases are linked to new US sanctions on Russian oil, affecting exports to top importers like China and India.
  • Other sectors, such as paints and tyres, also experienced stock declines due to rising oil prices.
"The new Russian sanctions... are a net addition to at-risk supply, adding more uncertainty to the (first quarter) outlook," - RBC Capital analysts.

The recent rise in crude oil prices and significant sanctions against Russian oil will likely have ongoing implications for the global oil market, particularly affecting major importers like India and China.

item.title: Indobell Insulation shares make strong debut, listing at a 90% premium over the IPO price on BSE SME - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Indobell Insulation shares make strong debut, listing at a 90% premium over the IPO price on BSE SME

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The shares of Indobell Insulations Ltd debuted on the BSE SME platform with a remarkable 90% premium over the IPO price, reflecting investor confidence.

  • Indobell Insulation shares listed at Rs 87.40, up from an IPO issue price of Rs 46.
  • The IPO was oversubscribed 54 times during its offering period from January 6-8, 2025.
  • The company's market valuation reached Rs 57.81 crore post-listing.
"The shares of Indobell Insulations Ltd were listed at Rs 87.40 per share on the BSE SME platform, a strong premium of 90 percent against its issue price."

This successful listing illustrates the strong demand for stocks in the primary market, particularly in the SME sector.

item.title: Rupee set for biggest single day fall in nearly two years: Key drivers explained - CNBCTV18
item.description:
The rupee continued its decline for the second straight session on Monday (Jan 13), falling 27 paise to a record low of 86.31 against the US dollar.

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Indian rupee is on track for its steepest single-day fall since February 2023, hitting a record low against the US dollar. Here are the key drivers of this decline:

  • Strengthening US dollar: The dollar index climbed 0.22% to 109.72, driven by better-than-expected job growth in the US.
  • Surge in crude oil prices: Brent crude rose to $80.91 per barrel, increasing import costs and widening India's trade deficit.
  • Foreign fund outflows: FIIs sold ₹2,254.68 crore worth of equities on January 10.
  • Weak domestic market sentiment: The BSE Sensex dropped by 550.49 points to 76,828.42.
  • Declining forex reserves: India’s forex reserves dropped by $5.693 billion to $634.585 billion this week.
The rupee’s performance throughout the session will depend on global market trends, oil price movements, and domestic equity performance.

Forex traders warn of continued volatility with the US dollar expected to remain strong.

item.title: Adani Wilmar share price crashes 9% as offer for sale underway; promoter exercises oversubscription option | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Adani Wilmar Share Price Drops 9% Amid Offer for Sale

Publication Date: January 10, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Adani Wilmar's share price experienced a significant decline of over 9% in early trading as the company's offer for sale (OFS) opened for retail investors. The company announced that its promoters would exercise the oversubscription option.

The price opened at ₹271.05, marking a nearly 7% drop from the previous close of ₹291.60, and dipped further to a low of ₹267.45.

Key Points

  • Promoters are exercising an oversubscription option.
  • 1,96,29,910 shares will be available in the OFS.
  • Overall offering will amount to up to 19,50,86,522 equity shares.
  • The base offer includes 17,54,56,612 shares (13.50% of total capital).
“The views and recommendations made above are those of individual analysts or broking companies, and not of Mint. We advise investors to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.”

This decrease in stock price reflects market responses to the ongoing OFS and may impact investor sentiment.

item.title: Crude sensitive stocks slump as Brent oil prices surge past $81; HPCL, IndiGo, BPCL slip upto 6% - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Crude Sensitive Stocks Decline as Brent Oil Prices Rise Over $81

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Brent crude prices have surged past $81 per barrel, resulting in a decline in crude sensitive stocks across various sectors due to fears of rising input costs.

  • Brent crude prices hit a three-month high driven by US sanctions on Russian oil.
  • Oil marketers, airlines, and other industries reliant on crude faced significant price impacts.
  • Shares of Hindustan Petroleum, Indian Oil, and Bharat Petroleum fell between 1-6%.
  • Airlines like InterGlobe Aviation and SpiceJet saw declines of up to 4%.
“The sanctions are expected to severely hurt Russian oil exports to India and China.”

This increase in oil prices may lead to a shift in sourcing patterns for major importers, continuing the pressure on crude sensitive sectors.

item.title: Strong Debut! Standard Glass Lining shares list at ₹172 on NSE, up 22.8% from IPO price | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Strong Debut! Standard Glass Lining shares list at ₹172 on NSE, up 22.8% from IPO price

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Standard Glass Lining Technology shares debuted strongly, listing at ₹172 on the NSE, a 22.8% premium over the IPO issue price of ₹140.

  • Listed at ₹176 on BSE, up 25.71%.
  • IPO valued at ₹410 crore; open for subscription from January 6-8, 2024.
  • Demand was high with the IPO being subscribed 185.48 times.
  • Retail segment was booked 65.71 times; NII was 275.21 times.
  • Proceeds will fund capital expenditure and repayment of borrowings.
  • Strong growth potential with CAGR of 20-25% expected.
SBI Securities recommends subscribing for long-term investment due to strong growth potential.

Standard Glass Lining Technology, established in 2012, specializes in engineering equipment for the pharmaceutical and chemical sectors.

item.title: Apple, Foxconn raise alarm over equipment delays at Chinese ports, seek government help - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Apple and Foxconn Seek Government Help Over Equipment Delays at Chinese Ports

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Apple and Foxconn India have raised concerns regarding delays in shipments of specialized manufacturing equipment from Chinese ports, which could impact Apple's expansion plans in India.

  • Delays in specialized equipment could affect production lines for new iPhone models.
  • Current production remains unaffected, but prolonged delays pose a risk.
  • The situation is possibly a response from China following India's visa restrictions on Chinese officials.
  • If escalated, the equipment holdups could impact India's handset and electronics industry significantly.
  • Government officials have been made aware of the shipment issues.
“Shipments of specialised manufacturing equipment meant for India have been held up in China ports for several months.”

This situation highlights the fragile nature of international supply chains and the potential repercussions for manufacturing in India.

item.title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex crashes 800 points & Nifty50 tests 23,200; rupee dips to life-time low of - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex crashes 800 points & Nifty50 tests 23,200; rupee dips to life-time low of 86

Publication Date: Date not provided Source: Times of India

The BSE Sensex saw a significant crash of 800 points, with the Nifty50 touching 23,200. Additionally, the Indian rupee has reached a lifetime low of 86 against the US dollar, heightening concerns over the economy.

  • BSE Sensex crashes 800 points, marking a significant decline.
  • Nifty50 index tests the 23,200 level amidst market volatility.
  • Rupee reaches a record low of 86 against the US dollar.
  • Market analysts highlight the implications for investors and the economy.
"The ongoing volatility in the market has left many investors apprehensive about their investments." - Financial Analyst

This situation suggests a challenging outlook for the market and economy. Investors are urged to be cautious as further volatility may occur.

item.title: Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty tanks, rupee hits all-time low - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty tanks, rupee hits all-time low

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The stock market faced a significant downturn on Monday, primarily driven by declines in real estate, financial services, and consumer durables stocks.

  • The BSE Sensex dropped by 677.22 points (0.88%) to 76,701.69.
  • The NSE Nifty fell by 212.90 points (0.91%) to 23,218.60.
  • The rupee reached an all-time low of 86.3537 per dollar due to a rally in the US dollar.
  • Zomato Ltd was the worst performer among Sensex stocks, declining by 2.86%.
  • Only two Sensex stocks recorded gains: IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank.
  • Sectors including Realty, Midsmall Financial Services, and Consumer Durables saw the largest declines.
"This comes with the rupee hitting an all-time low of 86.3537 per dollar."

The market is anticipated to face continued volatility as this decline may significantly affect investor sentiment and economic forecasts.

item.title: Shark Tank's Anupam Mittal calls out L&T chairman with hilarious question: 'If husband, wife don’t look at each other…' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Anupam Mittal Responds Hilariously to L&T Chairman's Controversial Remarks

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Anupam Mittal from Shark Tank India humorously responded to L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks about employee productivity versus home life. His witty reply raised awareness on work-life balance issues.

  • L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan suggested he would prefer if employees worked on Sundays.
  • He posed a controversial question regarding how long employees could stare at their wives at home.
  • Anupam Mittal joked that if husbands and wives don't look at each other, India won't remain the most populous country.
  • Deepika Padukone and other public figures criticized Subrahmanyan's remarks, emphasizing the importance of mental health.
  • L&T attempted to clarify the chairman's comments, which some experts deemed insufficient.
“But sir, if husband and wife don’t look at each other, how will we remain the most populous country in the world?” - Anupam Mittal

The exchange highlights the ongoing discourse regarding workplace culture and the significance of mental health in corporate environments.

item.title: Rupee dips past 86/USD for the first time on hawkish Fed outlook - The Economic Times
item.description:
Indian Rupee Weakens Past 86.50/USD Amid Dollar Surge

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: Various Traders Reports

The Indian rupee has fallen below the critical level of 86.50 against the U.S. dollar for the first time, affected by a strong dollar and significant outflows from local equities.

  • The rupee declined to 86.54, marking its lowest record level.
  • This decline represents a nearly 0.7% drop on the day.
  • A strong U.S. jobs report has increased the dollar's strength and U.S. bond yields.
  • Foreign investors have sold over $4 billion worth of Indian stocks and bonds in January.
  • The rupee's volatility has increased over the past three months.
  • Expectations are growing for a more flexible exchange rate policy from India's central bank.
“The loss of the rupee's competitiveness has become a pressing issue,” ANZ Bank noted.

In conclusion, the continuing decline of the rupee signals potential challenges for the Indian economy as it navigates heightened volatility and shifting global financial dynamics.

item.title: Rupee to weaken past 86/USD on hawkish Fed outlook - The Economic Times
item.description:
Rupee Dips Past 86/USD for the First Time on Hawkish Fed Outlook

Publication Date: [Date not specified] Source: [Source not specified]

The Indian rupee has weakened past the 86 to the U.S. dollar for the first time, prompted by a stronger than expected U.S. jobs report which has implications for the Federal Reserve's interest rate strategy.

  • The rupee opened at a record low of 86.2050, falling from 85.9650 the previous Friday.
  • 256,000 jobs were added in the U.S. last month, significantly above expectations of 160,000.
  • The unemployment rate in the U.S. unexpectedly declined to 4.1%.
  • Speculators are likely to continue holding bearish positions on the rupee due to the recent job numbers.
  • The Federal Reserve may focus more on inflation as concerns about job market risks diminish.
  • Market expectations suggest only one rate cut by the Fed for the year ahead.
  • The dollar index reached a two-year high of 109.72, reflecting the strength of the U.S. dollar.
  • 10-year U.S. bond yields have risen to 4.76%.
“Having said that, I think we are now near levels where a number of negatives (for the rupee) are in the price. Plus, we are long overdue a decent correction.” – A currency trader

This new low for the rupee reflects broader economic trends and investor sentiment towards U.S. monetary policy.

item.title: Shorter deal closure cycles, pick up in discretionary spend: Why TCS CEO is bullish on 2025 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
TCS CEO Optimistic About 2025 Due to Shorter Deal Cycles and Increased Spending

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported mixed numbers for Q3 but remains optimistic about 2025, citing improved discretionary spending and shorter deal closure cycles.

  • TCS reports a strong total contract value (TCV) exceeding $10 billion.
  • The order book in Europe has reached an all-time high.
  • CEO K Krithivasan emphasizes a robust pipeline across all geographies and industry verticals.
“Ignore Q3, look at our outlook.” - K Krithivasan

The outlook for TCS remains positive, suggesting better performance in 2025, driven by various market opportunities.
